elements.description: `` is a Web Component that renders different content for different URLs. This enables client-side routing. Each content alternative is defined with a `` component: ``` ```

properties.name: root
properties.description: the root URL for this router

methods.name: _propertiesChanged
methods.description:
(override of `Polymer.PropertiesChanged._propertiesChanged`)

Callback called when any properties with accessors created via
`_createPropertyAccessor` have been set.

params.name: currentProps
params.description: Bag of all current accessor values

params.name: changedProps
params.description:
Bag of properties changed since the last
  call to `_propertiesChanged`

params.name: oldProps
params.description:
Bag of previous values for each property
  in `changedProps`

methods.name: onHistoryStateChanged
methods.description:
(override of `Vaadin.HistoryStateChangeMixin.onHistoryStateChanged`)

Callback called when the 'popstate' event is triggered on the window.

params.name: state
params.description: the state object associated with the active history entry

elements.name: Vaadin.RouterElement

attributes.name: root
attributes.description: the root URL for this router

elements.description:
`<vaadin-route>` is a Web Component that defines a single route for the
`<vaadin-router>` component.

```
<vaadin-route path="/users/:user" component="x-user-profile"></vaadin-route>
```
or with an inline template
```
<vaadin-route path="/users/:user">
  <tempalte>
    View [[user]]'s profile
  </template>
</vaadin-route>
```

properties.name: path
properties.description: Defines the path served by this route

properties.name: component
properties.description: Defines the component rendered for this route

methods.name: _createPropertyAccessor
methods.description:
Creates a setter/getter pair for the named property with its own
local storage.  The getter returns the value in the local storage,
and the setter calls `_setProperty`, which updates the local storage
for the property and enqueues a `_propertiesChanged` callback.

This method may be called on a prototype or an instance.  Calling
this method may overwrite a property value that already exists on
the prototype/instance by creating the accessor.

params.name: readOnly
params.description:
When true, no setter is created; the
  protected `_setProperty` function must be used to set the property

methods.name: _addPropertyToAttributeMap
methods.description:
Adds the given `property` to a map matching attribute names
to property names, using `attributeNameForProperty`. This map is
used when deserializing attribute values to properties.

methods.name: _definePropertyAccessor
methods.description: Defines a property accessor for the given property.

params.name: readOnly
params.description: When true, no setter is created

methods.name: ready
methods.description:
Lifecycle callback called when properties are enabled via
`_enableProperties`.

Users may override this function to implement behavior that is
dependent on the element having its property data initialized, e.g.
from defaults (initialized from `constructor`, `_initializeProperties`),
`attributeChangedCallback`, or values propagated from host e.g. via
bindings.  `super.ready()` must be called to ensure the data system
becomes enabled.

methods.name: _initializeProperties
methods.description:
Overrides `PropertiesChanged` method and adds a call to
`finalize` which lazily configures the element's property accessors.

methods.name: _initializeInstanceProperties
methods.description:
Called at ready time with bag of instance properties that overwrote
accessors when the element upgraded.

The default implementation sets these properties back into the
setter at ready time.  This method is provided as an override
point for customizing or providing more efficient initialization.

params.name: props
params.description:
Bag of property values that were overwritten
  when creating property accessors.

methods.name: _setProperty
methods.description:
Updates the local storage for a property (via `_setPendingProperty`)
and enqueues a `_proeprtiesChanged` callback.

methods.name: _getProperty
methods.description: Returns the value for the given property.

methods.name: _setPendingProperty
methods.description:
Updates the local storage for a property, records the previous value,
and adds it to the set of "pending changes" that will be passed to the
`_propertiesChanged` callback.  This method does not enqueue the
`_propertiesChanged` callback.

params.name: ext
params.description: Not used here; affordance for closure

return.desc: Returns true if the property changed

methods.name: _invalidateProperties
methods.description:
Marks the properties as invalid, and enqueues an async
`_propertiesChanged` callback.

methods.name: _enableProperties
methods.description:
Call to enable property accessor processing. Before this method is
called accessor values will be set but side effects are
queued. When called, any pending side effects occur immediately.
For elements, generally `connectedCallback` is a normal spot to do so.
It is safe to call this method multiple times as it only turns on
property accessors once.

methods.name: _flushProperties
methods.description:
Calls the `_propertiesChanged` callback with the current set of
pending changes (and old values recorded when pending changes were
set), and resets the pending set of changes. Generally, this method
should not be called in user code.

methods.name: _shouldPropertiesChange
methods.description:
Called in `_flushProperties` to determine if `_propertiesChanged`
should be called. The default implementation returns true if
properties are pending. Override to customize when
`_propertiesChanged` is called.

params.name: currentProps
params.description: Bag of all current accessor values

params.name: changedProps
params.description:
Bag of properties changed since the last
  call to `_propertiesChanged`

params.name: oldProps
params.description:
Bag of previous values for each property
  in `changedProps`

methods.name: _propertiesChanged
methods.description:
(override of `Polymer.PropertiesChanged._propertiesChanged`)

Callback called when any properties with accessors created via
`_createPropertyAccessor` have been set.

params.name: currentProps
params.description: Bag of all current accessor values

params.name: changedProps
params.description:
Bag of properties changed since the last
  call to `_propertiesChanged`

params.name: oldProps
params.description:
Bag of previous values for each property
  in `changedProps`

methods.name: _shouldPropertyChange
methods.description:
Method called to determine whether a property value should be
considered as a change and cause the `_propertiesChanged` callback
to be enqueued.

The default implementation returns `true` if a strict equality
check fails. The method always returns false for `NaN`.

Override this method to e.g. provide stricter checking for
Objects/Arrays when using immutable patterns.

return.desc:
Whether the property should be considered a change
  and enqueue a `_proeprtiesChanged` callback

methods.name: attributeChangedCallback
methods.description:
Implements native Custom Elements `attributeChangedCallback` to
set an attribute value to a property via `_attributeToProperty`.

methods.name: _attributeToProperty
methods.description:
Deserializes an attribute to its associated property.

This method calls the `_deserializeValue` method to convert the string to
a typed value.

params.name: type
params.description:
type to deserialize to, defaults to the value
returned from `typeForProperty`

methods.name: _propertyToAttribute
methods.description: Serializes a property to its associated attribute.

methods.name: _valueToNodeAttribute
methods.description:
Sets a typed value to an HTML attribute on a node.

This method calls the `_serializeValue` method to convert the typed
value to a string.  If the `_serializeValue` method returns `undefined`,
the attribute will be removed (this is the default for boolean
type `false`).

methods.name: _serializeValue
methods.description:
Converts a typed JavaScript value to a string.

This method is called when setting JS property values to
HTML attributes.  Users may override this method to provide
serialization for custom types.

return.desc:
String serialized from the provided
property  value.

methods.name: _deserializeValue
methods.description:
Converts a string to a typed JavaScript value.

This method is called when reading HTML attribute values to
JS properties.  Users may override this method to provide
deserialization for custom `type`s. Types for `Boolean`, `String`,
and `Number` convert attributes to the expected types.

params.name: type
params.description: Type to deserialize the string to.

return.desc: Typed value deserialized from the provided string.

staticMethods.name: createProperties
staticMethods.description: Creates property accessors for the given property names.

params.name: props
params.description: Object whose keys are names of accessors.

staticMethods.name: attributeNameForProperty
staticMethods.description:
Returns an attribute name that corresponds to the given property.
The attribute name is the lowercased property name. Override to
customize this mapping.

return.desc: Attribute name corresponding to the given property.

staticMethods.name: typeForProperty
staticMethods.description:
Overrides `PropertiesChanged` method to return type specified in the
static `properties` object for the given property.

return.desc: Type to which to deserialize attribute

staticMethods.name: finalize
staticMethods.description:
Finalizes an element definition, including ensuring any super classes
are also finalized. This includes ensuring property
accessors exist on the element prototype. This method calls
`_finalizeClass` to finalize each constructor in the prototype chain.

staticMethods.name: _finalizeClass
staticMethods.description:
Finalize an element class. This includes ensuring property
accessors exist on the element prototype. This method is called by
`finalize` and finalizes the class constructor.

elements.name: Vaadin.RouteElement

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: Defines the path served by this route

attributes.name: component
attributes.description: Defines the component rendered for this route

elements.description:
`<vaadin-router-link>` is a Web Component that defines an in-app link. It is similar to
an `<a>` tag but changes the URL without reloading the browser page. It uses the HTML5
History API.

```
<vaadin-router-link href="/users/sam">See Sam's profile</vaadin-router-link>
```

properties.name: href
properties.description: Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the link points to

properties.name: active
properties.description:
Whether or not the route this link points to is currently active.

(reflected to the `active` attribute)

elements.name: Vaadin.RouterLinkElement

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the link points to

attributes.name: active
attributes.description:
Whether or not the route this link points to is currently active.

(reflected to the `active` attribute)

methods.name: onHistoryStateChanged
methods.description: Callback called when the 'popstate' event is triggered on the window.

params.name: state
params.description: the state object associated with the active history entry

mixins.name: Vaadin.HistoryStateChangeMixin

classes.summary:
JavaScript class that renders different DOM content depending on
   a given path. It can re-render when triggered or on the 'popstate' event.

methods.name: getOptions
methods.description: Returns the current set of router options.

methods.name: setOptions
methods.description:
Updates one or several router options. Only the options properties that are
present in the parameter object are updated.

Returns the effective options set the update.

methods.name: getRoutes
methods.description:
Returns the current list of routes (as a shallow copy). Adding / removing
routes to / from the returned array does not affect the routing config,
but modifying the route objects does.

methods.name: setRoutes
methods.description:
Sets the routing config (replacing the existing one) and returns the
effective routing config after the opertaion.

params.name: routes
params.description:
a single route or an array of those
   (the array is shallow copied)

methods.name: addRoutes
methods.description:
Appends one or several routes to the routing config and returns the
effective routing config after the operation.

params.name: routes
params.description:
a single route or an array of those
   (the array is shallow copied)

methods.name: removeRoutes
methods.description:
Removes one or several routes from the routing config and returns the
effective routing config after the operation. The routes to remove are
searched in the routing config by reference equality, i.e. pass in the
exact route references that need to be removed.

params.name: routes
params.description: a single route or an array of those

methods.name: getOutlet
methods.description: Returns the current router outlet.

methods.name: setOutlet
methods.description: Sets the router outlet.

methods.name: resolve
methods.description:
Resolves the given path, i.e. calls all matching route handlers and returns
the result (as a promise).

If no route matches the given path the returned promise is rejected.

params.name: context
params.description: an optional context to pass to route handlers

methods.name: render
methods.description:
Resolves the given path and renders the route DOM into the router outlet if
it is set. If no router outlet is set at the time of calling this method,
it throws an Error.

Returns a promise that is fullfilled after the route DOM is inserted into
the router outlet, or rejected if no route matches the given path.

params.name: context
params.description: an optional context to pass to route handlers

staticMethods.name: renderComponent
staticMethods.description: Creates and returns an instance of a given custom element.

params.name: component
params.description: tag name of a web component to render

classes.name: Vaadin.Router
